## About {#seminario}

::: {.about-workshop}

This advanced workshop offers an afternoon of talks and discussion on how
**learning and attention** shape human cognition and behavior. The aim is to
bring together students and researchers interested in these topics and to
provide an accessible but research-oriented overview of current work in the
field.

The programme combines
[several invited talks](#speakers) with a **closing lecture** by
[Professor Mike Le Pelley](talks/mike.qmd), covering topics such as:

- Learning and attention in humans  
- Habit formation and goal-directed control  
- Experimental methods for studying cognitive processes  

The event is **in person**, free of charge, and especially intended for:

- Master’s and PhD students in psychology, cognitive science, and related areas  
- Early-career researchers interested in attention, learning, and decision making 
- Anyone curious about experimental and modelling approaches to cognition  

Participants who register via the [registration form](#inscripcion)
will receive a **certificate of attendance**.

:::
